intro: Polylepis hieronymi var. dolicholopha, commonly known as the long-lobed polylepis, is a rare and endemic species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaf lobes and its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments. This shrub or small tree has a rugged, frost-resistant structure adapted to the harsh mountain climate. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing protection against cold and wind. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local biodiversity and contributing to soil stabilization.
